My client are seeking a Transport Development Consultant, on an initial 3 month contract to evaluate the scope of footprint of one of their customers road transport current capability and future needs here in Australia.

• Play an integral part within a small, tightly focussed “Discovery” team to generate services for new customers that will turn into long-lasting relationships;

• Acquire a thorough understanding of key customer transport and logistics needs and requirements;

• Define and present customer transport and logistics requirements for review by the customer, including gap analysis;

• Work with the Australian and New Zealand Business Development teams and provide constructive advice in the design of solutions to address known gaps and identified opportunities;

• Research monitor market trends and seek potential customer feedback to develop solutions and launch new products and services to drive profitability;

• Use excellent judgement and highly developed analytical skills to deliver high quality decisions; and

• Develop and maintain good relationships with all key stakeholders and internal staff.

\xa0

• Knowledge of Australian road transport customer requirements, market trends, market structure and value proposition that wins the customer mind

\xa0• Network of Transport Operator relationships; \xa0

• Prior experience in customer support and business development role in a similar setting

• Exercising sound judgement to make consistent and robust decisions

• Demonstrated customer service focus, including the ability to recognise and implement business improvement opportunities

• Experience in working with multi-faceted customer and supplier environment to carry out day to day service delivery responsibilities

• Highly developed knowledge and understanding of the principles of road transport service delivery

• Established industry networks and Australian Road Transport associations accreditation preferred.

\xa0

Skills

• Excellent self-management skills, including working effectively without direct supervision, managing and organising fluctuating workloads in sometimes stressful situations

• Ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines in line with good customer service principles

• Sound analytical skills

• Ability to work well within a team environment and establish working relationships inside and outside the organisation

\xa0

Education

A relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent experience working in a role that developed knowledge of transport market and its behaviours may be of advantage.

883789953:
[

User Experience and Interface Designer

Company Name nura Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 111 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you obsessed with providing effective and beautifully crafted User Experiences for digital projects? Do you love music technology? Come work for the startup making the world’s smartest headphones!


About the Business

We all hear differently and this is the secret to sound clarity that is perfect for you. At nura, we have created the first headphones that adapt to your unique hearing the moment you wear them.


nura is a music technology startup founded in Melbourne. We are connected by music more than anything. That’s why we combined our expertise in engineering, acoustics, biology, and hearing science - to create the nuraphone - the headphone that finds your perfect sound, automatically.


You can read about us in FACT, THUMP, Acclaim, Cool Hunting, The Huffington Post, Engadget, Mashable, c|net, The Verge, Forbes + +


About the Role

We are looking for a Mid-weight UX & UI Designer, with practical industry experience. We have a wealth of digital projects spanning Web, App, and EDM design, with the opportunity to help shape the digital team. Candidates should be well versed in UX & UI practices, as well as the standard design packages.


Responsibilities


1. Assist Lead UX & UI Designer with all digital projects from a User Experience perspective.


UX processes:

- Content and asset audits.

- Basic wireframes, taken through to Low and High fidelity wireframes.

- Discussing and Defining technical requirements (CMS, CRM, 3rd Party technologies - etc).

- Defining Target Audiences, User personas and User objectives - \xa0from statistics and metrics.

- Creating User journeys and sitemaps.


2. Crafting engaging experiences for our customers, through User Interface design.


UI processes:

- Concept design and design development (Photoshop, Illustrator, Adobe XD, Sketch - etc).

- Responsive design for Tablet and Mobile reflow.

- Prototyping and Animation (InVision, InVision Studio, Adobe XD, Sketch - etc).
- Asset creation for Web, App, EDM and online campaigns.


3. Design, brief and oversee development of digital projects with our internal team.


4. Refine and improve our digital experiences through on-going testing and analytics.



Requirements

  • The successful candidate will be tertiary qualified with relevant degree

  • Have had 3-5 years' relevant experience in UX & UI Design.

  • Strong portfolio of live, commercial work

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and have the ability to easily relate to people at a variety of levels within a business.

  • A work ethic which consistently demonstrates flexibility, adaptability and logical thinking in your approach to tasks will have you well placed.

  • Cultivate partnerships: Builds respectful and collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Adapts style to communicate and influence effectively.

  • Adapt and learn: Actively learn through self-reflection, asks for feedback and tries new things. Manages own wellbeing and demonstrates resilience when faced with challenges.

  • Embrace accountability: Accepts responsibility for own behaviour, action and results.

  • Empower others: Provides feedback and suggestions to other team members to support them to deliver better results.

  • Deliver outcomes: Sets and upholds high standards of performance and contributes to the achievements of the team.

  • Shape strategy: Demonstrates an understanding of organisation and how their role fits in the bigger picture.

  • Have a keen eye for design, typography and detail.



Personal attributes

  • Self-motivated.

  • Professional and confident manner.

  • Adaptable and flexible.

  • A strong communicator, both verbally and in writing.

  • Passionate about high-quality services.

  • A team player who can also work autonomously.

  • A multi-tasker, with great time management skills (who can manage and meet deadlines).



A definite plus…

  • Background or strong personal interest in design.

  • Love of the music industry.

  • Headphone fanatic.



To apply

Instead of a cover letter, please provide an unlisted link to a YouTube video of no more than 3 minutes, introduce yourself and creatively answer three questions:


- Describe the best project you have managed, your role, how you did it and the business outcome.

- Describe your biggest innovative/entrepreneurial achievement.

- Describe your relationship to music and/or technology.


Please send the YouTube link and CV to jobs@nuraphone.com with the reference “Mid-weight UX & UI Designer” in the subject field.


We look forward to hearing from you! Please note that if you do not hear back from us within one month of applying that we have kept your CV on file and will consider you for other roles.


Additional Requirements

The successful applicant will be required to undergo a Police Check prior to appointment.

Director, Safety

The North East Link Authority will connect the missing link in Melbourne’s freeway network, while increasing the capacity of the Eastern Freeway. It will slash travel times, get trucks off local roads and link key growth areas in the north and south-east


About the opportunity

We're moving ahead on Victoria's biggest ever road transport project and we are looking for a passionate Director, Safety to join our growing Authority

Back End Developer

Company Name Ento.com Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 97 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Ento is a Melbourne based SaaS start-up building a workforce success platform that enables enterprises to automate, engage, optimise and succeed with their large shift-based workforces.

The industry we exist in is inherently complex but the market demands simplicity. Our product team thrives on this challenge by balancing flexibility and power with speed and beauty.

About you

You’ll be an experienced developer who takes pride in delivering clean, optimised code and enjoys knowing that the code you ship is being used by thousands of people every day.

Solving complex problems and designing elegant solutions is your bread and butter. You take pride in knowing that your solutions are scalable and will support future growth.

With an entrepreneurial mindset, you’ll love working on modern technology and being part of a smart, capable and high-performing team.

What you’ll do

  • Build new functionality across Ento’s product suite
  • Collaborate with team members to raise the bar on the features and functionality we build
  • Work with product owners and leads to write specifications which describe how you’ll solve customer problems
  • Coordinate with our QA and Customer Success teams to ensure quality and clear communication of solutions
  • Contribute to daily stand-ups, feature demos and code reviews with all members of the product team
  • Triage and solve issues that are raised by customers

Your background

  • Experience with software development - ideally in a product environment\xa0
  • Exposure to at least one major PHP framework - ideally Symfony as we use this in-house, but others like Laravel, CodeIgniter, CakePHP or Yii are good too
  • Technically, and commercially, minded - you’ll enjoy a technical challenge, and can design a range of solutions that fit and can adapt to commercial pressures
  • Modern development practices - experience with GIT, code reviews and agile. Knowledge of continuous integration and continuous deployment are a plus
  • Good interpersonal skills - able to communicate clearly in all forms. We aim for transparency and we respect open and honest communication
  • Customer-aware/focused - our work is more than just code and we take pride in putting the customer at the centre of everything we do
  • Self-aware - ability to be honest and candid about when you need support. We know products are complicated - everyone’s here to help!

What’s on offer

  • You’ll be utilising modern technology (PHP7, Symphony 3x and AWS) and working with an Agile delivery team to deliver software that is used by thousands of people every day
  • A chance to be at the forefront of architecting & delivering modern, scalable and performant high value, business critical software
  • Awesome culture - we are big on things like respect, transparency, curiosity, intelligence, consistency and finishing - we really like to get things done
  • An amazing office aesthetic - seriously. We’ve got light, sun filled spaces, modern hardware and purpose built working spaces
  • Handy to trams, trains, cafe’s and the gym - but why would you want to go anywhere when we’ve got ping pong, a pool table and drinks on a friday!
  • We pull off the impossible and you’ll love working with us

Job description

  • Full time position, Southbank Location

The Organisation

Oliver Hume Corporation is a privately owned property group, incorporating real estate services and a property funds business, with over 60 years' experience in the Australian market. Acclaimed as one of Australia’s leading residential project marketers, Oliver Hume Real Estate Group is the marketing force behind an enviable list of some of Australia’s most reputable residential communities and residential development companies.

The Position

The Project Coordinator position plays an important role in the Project Marketing team and provides an amazing opportunity to be involved in some of Melbourne's largest residential developments, working alongside well-experienced delivery teams to grow Melbourne.

Some of the activities you will be undertaking:

Job description

Job Advertisement Clinical/Health Psychologist Grade 2 - Individual Therapy and Group Therapy Research– Melbourne Calvary Health Care Bethlehem – Located in the beachside suburb of Parkdale, 3194 @ 152 Como Parade.
Calvary Health Care Bethlehem provides a range of inpatient, community and ambulatory services for palliative and progressive neurological conditions.

Calvary Health Care Bethlehem is the statewide tertiary provider of specialist care for people living with progressive neurological diseases (e.g., Motor Neuron Disease and Huntington’s disease). We are recognized both nationally and internationally for being at the forefront of care and research for these conditions. With a reputation for innovation, the broad multidisciplinary team works collaboratively within a unique neuropalliative rehabilitation framework to provide best practice assessment and holistic care for both patients and families. The psychology role is varied and stimulating, involving assessment, intervention and opportunities for research, education and training.

About The Role

We seek an addition to our team of one (4 days per week) or two (2 days per week) Clinical/Health Psychologists to work within our highly-skilled, supportive and dynamic Psychology Department that has a strong commitment to psychological treatment and clinical research.

This role would suit a mature and sensitive clinician who is passionate about improving the lives of people faced with life-limiting illnesses and associated physical, cognitive and psychiatric changes. The successful candidate would join our team of Clinical Psychologists and Clinical Neuropsychologists, who provide access to regular supervision and professional development opportunities.

The Present Opportunity Has Two Components, Both Focused On Addressing The Emotional Impact Of PNDs On The Individual With The Illness, As Well As Their Family
  • a permanent 2 day per week psychological treatment role
  • an 18 month 2 day per week role responsible for developing, implementing and evaluating a mindfulness-based stress reduction group programme for patients and families


What You Bring
  • a minimum of a master’s degree in clinical or health psychology
  • general registration with AHPRA (specialist endorsement in Clinical or Health Psychology is desirable)
  • current clinical knowledge in the field of progressive neurology is desirable
  • excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • willingness to work within a multidisciplinary team
  • a desire to join a team committed to the care of others in a mission based organization


Benefits

This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a leading mission based health care organization. We offer paid parental leave, clinical supervision, salary packaging, career progression, flexible working hours, training, and skills development. Calvary is also proud to be recognized as a leader in gender equality. Further details are available here: https://www.calvarycare.org.au/careers/benefits/
Highlights of working at Calvary
Join one of Australia’s leading health, community and aged care providers

Innovators in best practice care

Work within a large specialist multidisciplinary team

Excellent salary packaging options available

Accessible public transport and car parking options

About Calvary

Calvary is a national Catholic provider of health, community and aged care services operating in six states and territories. Our services include public and private hospital care, acute and sub-acute care, home care services and retirement and aged care services, in both rural and metropolitan areas. Calvary employs over 11,000 people and has over 1,500 volunteers.

Calvary continues the mission of the Sisters of the Little Company of Mary, a mission focused on communicating the inestimable dignity and value of each person. We express our values of hospitality, healing, stewardship and respect through “being for others” exemplified by the Calvary Spirit and the example of Venerable Mary Potter .
How to join the team To join our diverse, compassionate and dedicated team for a rewarding Calvary career, please submit an online application via Calvary Careers: www.calvary.mercury.com.au - by close of business Monday 15 October 2018.
In applying for this role, please provide your CV with 2 referees and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and suitability for the role.
As part of the application process, you may be required to participate in a health evaluation, which could include face to face assessment and drug and alcohol testing, to ensure your suitability for the role. Please note we are unable to accept emailed applications or resumes and phone calls from recruitment agencies.

The Assistant Director – Learning & Development Operations is a strategic and key role within the organisation. You will provide key support across various sites to assess skills sets, training modules and schedules and manage metrics of reporting.


Answering to 3 direct reports, this is an operational role that will see the right candidate write policies and procedures, define deliverables and track milestones and integrate technology and systems that support operations.


Ideal candidates will be analytically minded, a proven relationship builder, Lean thinking, hands on and process orientated. You will have excellent knowledge of LMS and MS Office tools, and continuous improvement methods. Whilst not a delivery role, you will be experience in L&D within either corporate or government organisations.


Our client is committed to diversity and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds.


Closing date for this role is October 2nd 2018.


For further details please apply or call Callum Paterson in People @ Work on 5221 5599

Job description

Saputo Dairy Australia is Australia’s largest dairy foods company and we are committed to being the first choice in dairy foods in Australia and globally.

We currently have an opportunity for a Shopper Marketing Coordinator to co-ordinate the planning, development and implementation of shopper marketing activities across all brands. It requires substantial cross-functional co-ordination between sales, brand marketing, legal, shopper marketing agencies and retailer contacts.

Key responsibilities

  • Assist in creation and maintenance of shopper marketing calendar
  • Participate in the planning, briefing and development of shopper marketing campaigns
  • Co-ordinate implementation of shopper marketing campaigns in accordance with timing plans and budget
  • Co-ordinate with brand marketing and sales teams to ensure all elements of a campaign are seamlessly implemented and meet retailer requirements
  • Track performance of and evaluate shopper marketing campaigns based on achievement of objectives and Return on Investment
  • Maintain financial records and other administrative tasks
  • Develop a library of great shopper marketing examples
  • Manage specific projects as allocated by Category Development and Shopper Lead

Required Skills & Experience

  • Tertiary qualifications in Marketing or Commerce
  • Minimum of 2 years marketing or sales experience
  • FMCG experience preferred
  • Analytical experience e.g. use of IRI or Nielsen scan data
  • Project management experience
  • Competent user of Microsoft Office Suite
  • Social media and digital savvy

The successful candidate will also have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with internal and external stakeholders at all levels.

Applications close 14 October 2018

Corporate Affairs Manager

Company Name Melbourne Racing Club Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 214 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity


This newly created position, reporting into the Executive Director of Property & Corporate Affairs will see you taking responsibility for the development and delivery of our strategy for government and community engagement across the entirety of the MRC business.


Your ability to build and maintain strong relationships with senior individuals will set you up for success in this role as you navigate the key external relationships across a range of state and local government where you will also assist in developing and managing events involving our government stakeholders.


Communications will always be at the heart of what you do and this will put you in a strong position to be able to develop our government focussed communications, refining MRC government narrative and proactively identify and manage emerging issues that may impact the reputation of the Melbourne Racing Club.


What are we looking for?


  • Previous experience in a similar role within a regulated environment
  • A strong background in a government relations, public affairs or policy environment
  • Experience in advising, influencing and partnering with senior executives on Government activities and policies
  • Excellent advocacy and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to build relationships across all levels of Government
  • Exceptional ability to write clear, concise and evidence based positions, statements, submissions and other advocacy tools and documents
  • Tertiary qualifications in politics, public policy, law, communications or a related field

\xa0

Company Culture


We’re a business that is passionate what we do - putting on world class events and race days and that is reflective in our staff - we’re a passionate, hardworking and fun team of professionals! No two days will ever be the same and although you’ll have some days that will challenge you, you’ll enjoying celebrating our successes by soaking up the atmosphere of one of our events and race days knowing that you integral part of the whole operation!

\xa0

Benefits Include, but not limited too


  • Free onsite parking
  • Racing Industry Passes
  • Health & Wellbeing programs
  • Ongoing Training & Development


The Melbourne Racing Club recognises and values workplace diversity.
